author: Katy Stech Ferek
title: Tops Markets Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Protection
text:
Supermarket chain Tops Markets LLC filed for bankruptcy protection Wednesday, the latest regional grocery chain to look to restructure its balance sheet as consumers move to nontraditional food retailers.
The Williamsville, N.Y., company, which operates about 170 supermarkets in New York, Pennsylvania, Vermont under the Tops name, said it plans to stay open during bankruptcy. It employs more than 14,000 people—most of whom belong to unions—and has lined up $265 million in loans to fund its business during the chapter 11 case.
